{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3532226,"name":null,"username":"7dblackhole","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/7dblackhole/{size}/200189_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-19T01:25:46.519Z","cooked":"

Problem Description

Based on this code from Mechanical Advantage and this accompanying post, we have tried to implement trig-based pose estimation using the 3d distance supplied by limelight. Because only one tag is visible, megatag2 becomes increasingly ambiguous as we get further away from the tag, strafing to the left or right as we move straight back. While the distance of a solver retains accuracy, this strafing results in the straight-line displacement to fall short. Using the code below, we are able to match the megatag2 pose while removing the ambiguous perpendicular drift. Negating the tync value* in the first Rotation3d allows us to also gain the correct offset to compensate for the parallel distance (ex. We are 0.18m off with a 4m displacement, negating tync gives us an 0.18m offset). However, this offset is toward the tag instead of away from it, resulting in twice the positional error instead of removing it. Our main problem is that after double and triple checking all of our robot to camera offsets, altering every piece of the math in every way we can think of, and checking all of the robot to camera offsets again, the offset is either zero (when tync is multiplied by -1), the correct value in the wrong direction (when tync is multiplied by 1), or some value in between (when any other multiple is applied). Because ty is an angle, with the two poles of the circle defined by the translation it rotates seemingly lying on 0 and the offset in the incorrect direction, there seems to be no good way to move the offset in the right direction.

*making it positive (it’s already negative)

Basic Related Information

https://github.com/Team4028/2025-Reefscape/blob/alpha/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/limelight/Limelight.java#L116-L136

Translation2d camToTagTranslation = new Pose3d(Translation3d.kZero,
         new Rotation3d(0, Units.degreesToRadians(-tync), Units.degreesToRadians(txnc)))
         .transformBy(
                 new Transform3d(new Translation3d(vRes.rawFiducials()[0].distToCamera(), 0, 0), 
                     Rotation3d.kZero))
         .getTranslation()
         .rotateBy(new Rotation3d(0, io.getRobotToCamera().getRotation().getY(), 0))
         .toTranslation2d();

double camToTagRotation = driveYawRad + io.getRobotToCamera().getRotation().getZ()
         + camToTagTranslation.getAngle().getRadians();

Translation2d fieldToCameraTranslation = new Pose2d(tagPose2d.getTranslation(),
         Rotation2d.fromRadians(camToTagRotation - Math.PI / 2))
         .transformBy(new Transform2d(camToTagTranslation.getNorm(), 0, Rotation2d.kZero))
         .getTranslation();

Pose2d robotPose = new Pose2d(fieldToCameraTranslation, 
Rotation2d.fromRadians(driveYawRad - io.getRobotToCamera().getRotation().getZ()))
         .transformBy(new Transform2d(new Pose2d(io.getRobotToCamera().getX(), -io.getRobotToCamera().getY(),   
              io.getRobotToCamera().getRotation().toRotation2d().times(-1)), Pose2d.kZero));

Infodump

  • Here is a video of AdvantageScope 3d field demonstrating the skew we are experiencing and the offset of tync being positive which compensates in the wrong direction
    edit.mp4 - Google Drive
    • Solid Robot is Odometry/Pose Estimator (updated by trig pose with {0.1, 0.1} xy devs)
    • Purple Ghost is trig pose
    • Yellow Ghost is megatag2
  • We are using a single limelight 4 with a helio accelerator (which HAS improved our performance) and a pristine-condition tag id 7 at the correct height
    • we are using the imu in mode 1 to seed and mode 2 during enabled teleop. We are setting the mode periodically as recommended and it works correctly
  • We are using AdvantageKit with Mechanical Advantage’s swerve template for TalonFX swerve and TunerConstants from Phoenix Tuner X’s swerve generator, we have characterized the drivetrain
